page.title: 07Elsenham Railway
page.content: gates. The signal box at the station was closed in 1983 and all the signals on the track are now computer operated from Cambridge. An electric bell rings when a train is approaching so staff know when to close the gates. Presently trains go through Elsenham station at about 60mph. However, it is intended that the curve of the track will be less severe,and trains will travel through at 80mph. From Elsenham to Cambridge Station is 56 miles and to Londons Liverpool Sreet it is 35 miles. A standard return ticket to London is Â£8.20; a cheap day return is Â£4.50. About 550 tickets are sold each week. It is mainly used by commuters to Bishops Stortford, Harlow, London and Cambridge. .
